posts.description: We support Google: APIs shouldn’t be copyrightable – Points of interest
posts.extended: If APIs are private property that can’t be copied without permission, it would be as if no two checkout systems could use the same form field labels. Everyone would have to find their own way of saying “address” and “city” or buy a license or risk getting sued.

posts.description: minimaxir/automl-gs: Provide an input CSV and a target field to predict, generate a model + code to run it.
posts.extended: Give an input CSV file and a target field you want to predict to automl-gs, and get a trained high-performing machine learning or deep learning model plus native Python code pipelines allowing you to integrate that model into any prediction workflow.
The one thing that you cannot do without, that so many people mess up is simply a sentence that clearly describes what it is and what it does. Getting that written gets you most of the way there.

The Personal Analytics of My Life—Stephen Wolfram Blog
How and why I use (neo)vim - macwright.org
posts.extended: I saw TextMate go out of style and other contenders enter, and that solidified my decision to stay with vim. The lifecycle of a flashy new text editor is shorter than my intended career track, and I want to invest in tools that will stick around.
